text:
N. Subramanian, Minister for Adi Dravidar Welfare, on Thursday, laid the foundation stone for school building at Vellala Viduthi village near Gandharvakottai. He said the building, sanctioned under the Rashtriya Madhaymik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA), will be built at an estimate of Rs.1.61 crore. S. Marimuthu, District Revenue Officer, said the plinth area of the building will be 16,000 sq. ft. — 8,000 each on the ground and first floor. It will ensure more space for the students and teachers.

Construction

workers to get aid

A sum of Rs. 2.80 crore has been allocated to the construction workers of Karaikal district towards off-season assistance. As many as 7,000 construction workers will benefit under the scheme and each worker will get Rs. 4,000, said P. Rajavelu, Puducherry Minister for Labour. Speaking at a function to mark the inauguration of own building for the Government Women’s Polytechnic at an estimate of Rs. 60 lakh, he said relief would be disbursed by the Construction Workers’ Welfare Board.
title: Stone laid for school building
